ENDCONTEXT
The Great Fire of Rome happened between July 2 and July 6, 1666. It led to the complete devastation of major parts of Rome, including the Colosseum and 100 public baths. Interestingly, despite such catastrophic damage, there were no reported casualties due to the fire.

ENDINPUT
